description: A study of the invention of the devotional lyric in English, with a focus on the work of the seventeenth-century poets John Donne, George Herbert, Richard Crashaw, Henry Vaughan, and Thomas Traherne. The impact of this experimental literary movement on such twentieth and twenty-first century critics and poets as T. S. Eliot, William Empson, Simone Weil, Elizabeth Bishop, Anne Carson, and Christian Wiman.
title: Early Modern Devotional Poetry
extra_flags:

  • YC English: Renaissance
